meanings.definition: Inspiring fear or unease; strange or mysterious.
meanings.sent1: The abandoned house looked eerier as the sun set, casting long shadows.
meanings.sent2: The fog made the forest eerier than usual, making it hard to see what was lurking.
meanings.sent3: The eerier sound of the wind howling outside made the children giggle nervously.
meanings.sent4: The eerier silence of the graveyard at midnight felt like a scene from a horror movie.
meanings.sent5: The eerier presence of the ghostly figure sent shivers down my spine.

meanings.definition: Causing a feeling of fear or unease; spooky.
meanings.sent1: The eerier shadows in the dimly lit room made me feel like I was being watched.
meanings.sent2: The old, creaky house had an eerier atmosphere that sent chills down my spine.
meanings.sent3: The eerier feeling of being alone in the dark room made me wish for company.
meanings.sent4: The eerier sensation of cold fingers brushing against my neck made me jump in fright.
meanings.sent5: The eerier presence of the mysterious figure made my heart race with fear.

meanings.definition: More frightening or unsettling than something else.
meanings.sent1: The eerier movie was scarier than the one we watched last week.
meanings.sent2: The eerie forest at night seemed eerier than the haunted house.
meanings.sent3: The eerier mask at the costume party made everyone jump in surprise.
meanings.sent4: The eerier painting in the gallery stood out among the other artworks.
meanings.sent5: The eerier scene in the play left the audience gasping in shock.
